title: The Long Recall
outcome: On the anniversary of Halden’s BCI pilot, public gatherings and lost footage reveal personal accounts, sparking a citywide movement for collective memory and open debate. Emotional forums humanize former victims and system architects, shifting the focus from control to citywide reconciliation and shared purpose.

events.description: Free zone storytellers and former BCI test subjects hold open-air gatherings, sharing personal histories of BCI’s early impact. Public interest surges in firsthand accounts.

A documentarian unveils lost footage from the first BCI pilot regions, showing early injustices and Halden’s conflict over the system’s development. The footage spreads rapidly through word-of-mouth and public screenings.
Inspired by the footage, large-scale forums open citywide. Former Council and Directorate members speak publicly for the first time, offering apologies and calls for dialogue.

Emotional debate shifts the city’s mood: focus turns from blame and retribution to collective healing. Councils and citizens discuss new reconciliation measures and reimagining city governance based on mutual memory and trust.
